newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai Farmers, Siam Commercial fall on downgrade.
newsitem.headline: Thai Farmers, Siam Commercial fall on downgrade.

text.p: Shares of Thai Farmers Bank Plc and Siam Commercial Bank Plc dropped in late morning trade on Tuesday after Standard and Poors' (S&P) Corp downgraded their credit ratings, brokers said.
By 0415 GMT, Thai Farmers Bank was down three baht to 114 on the most active trade of 129 million baht. Siam Commercial Bank dipped two baht to 130.
"Both shares were nearly stable early before the S&P announcement triggered heavy selling on the stocks," said one broker at Nava Finance.
Rating agency S&P said on Tuesday it has downgraded the credit ratings of Thai Farmers and Siam Commercial to BBB-plus/A2 from A-minus/A2.
It said the rating downgrades of Thai Farmers and Siam Commercial reflected the need for further provisions which would significantly affect the banks' profitability and capital levels.
S&P said its rating outlook for the two banks had been changed to negative from stable.

"The rating actions recognise Standard and Poor's concerns about the deteriorating condition of Thailand's financial sector, which has come under increasing pressure with the downturn in the property market and a slowdown in the economy," the rating agency said.
Analysts said the downgrading of both banks' credit ratings will raise their cost of foreign borrowings and affect their earnings.
